intro: Scaphochlamys limiana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange blooms that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it has a woody stem that can grow up to several meters in height. Scaphochlamys limiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
